Package com.example.scanpal

Class AttendeeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.scanpal.AttendeeController
public class AttendeeController extends Object
Manages attendee data interactions with a Firestore database and internal storage. Provides methods to add, fetch, update, and delete attendee records.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    AttendeeController(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore database, android.content.Context context)
    Constructs an AttendeeController with a specified Firestore database instance and application context.

  • Constructor Details

    • AttendeeController

      public AttendeeController(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore database, android.content.Context context)
      Constructs an AttendeeController with a specified Firestore database instance and application context. This constructor initializes the controller ready for attendee data management operations.
      Parameters:
      database - The Firestore database instance for operations.
      context - The application context used for file operations.

  • Method Details

    • getDatabase

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore getDatabase()

    • addAttendee

      public void addAttendee(Attendee attendee, AttendeeAddCallback callback)
      Adds a new attendee record to the Firestore database and optionally to local storage. This method serializes the Attendee object and saves it, then updates the Firestore database with attendee details including location, RSVP status, and event association.
      Parameters:
      attendee - The attendee to be added.
      callback - An AttendeeAddCallback to handle success or error outcomes.

    • fetchAttendee

      public void fetchAttendee(String attendeeId, AttendeeFetchCallback callback)
      Fetches an attendee's details from the Firestore database or local storage if available. This method attempts to retrieve the attendee details based on the attendee ID, providing an async callback with the result.
      Parameters:
      attendeeId - The unique ID of the attendee to fetch.
      callback - An AttendeeFetchCallback to handle the fetched data or errors.

    • updateAttendee

      public void updateAttendee(Attendee attendee, AttendeeUpdateCallback callback)
      Updates an existing attendee's information in the Firestore database and local storage. This method allows updating fields such as RSVP status and checked-in status, ensuring the attendee record is current.
      Parameters:
      attendee - The Attendee object with updated details to be saved.
      callback - An AttendeeUpdateCallback to handle success or error outcomes.

    • deleteAllUserAttendees

      public void deleteAllUserAttendees(String username, DeleteAllAttendeesCallback callback)
      Deletes all attendee records associated with a user from Firestore and local storage.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose attendee records are to be deleted.
      callback - The callback for success or error handling.
